rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
NTBackup from Windows XP and later includes [[Shadow Copy|Volume Shadow Copy]] (VSS) support and thus can backup [[File locking|locked files]]. In case of Windows XP Home Edition, NTBackup is not installed by default but is available on the Windows XP installation disc. <ref> [http://support.microsoft.com/kb/302894 HOW TO: Install Backup from the CD-ROM in Windows XP Home Edition] </ref>
NTBackup from Windows XP and later includes [[Shadow Copy|Volume Shadow Copy]] (VSS) support and thus can backup [[File locking|locked files]]. In case of Windows XP Home Edition, NTBackup is not installed by default but is available on the Windows XP installation disc. <ref> [http://support.microsoft.com/kb/302894 HOW TO: Install Backup from the CD-ROM in Windows XP Home Edition] </ref>
â
In [[Windows Vista]] and later operating systems, NTBackup was replaced by Windows Backup, which uses the [[Virtual Hard Disk]] (VHD) file format. For reading older backups, Microsoft has made available the NTBackup Restore utility which can only read <tt>BKF</tt> files. <ref> [http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=7da725e2-8b69-4c65-afa3-2a53107d54a7&DisplayLang=en Windows NT Backup - Restore Utility] </ref>
+
In [[Windows Vista]] and later operating systems, NTBackup was replaced by Windows Backup, which uses the [[VHD (file format)|Virtual Hard Disk]] (VHD) file format. For reading older backups, Microsoft has made available the NTBackup Restore utility which can only read <tt>BKF</tt> files. <ref> [http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=7da725e2-8b69-4c65-afa3-2a53107d54a7&DisplayLang=en Windows NT Backup - Restore Utility] </ref>
